intro: Denekia muschleriana, commonly known as the Muschler's denekia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Denekia muschleriana is considered a rare and endangered species.
